TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void SaveEventHandler(object sender, SaveEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed SaveEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub SaveEventHandler(sender As Object, e As SaveEventArgs)
public delegate void SaveEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, SaveEventArgs ^ e);
type SaveEventHandler = delegate of obj * SaveEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a form.

remarks.para: Important: The code skeleton for an event handler associated with the Save event, which uses the SaveEventHandler delegate, should be added only from the Microsoft InfoPath user interface. For more information on how to add event handlers in InfoPath, see How Do I: Add an Event Handler.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: For an example of using the SaveEventHandler delegate, see the sample code in the Save event of the class.
